page.title: 03ENERGY BRAE
page.content: PEAT Many people in our block have peat banks.This is a strip of moorland where they can cut peat for their own use. First take the turf off the bank using a shetland spade.Next you use a special spade called a tushkar to cast the peat.Casting peat means cutting the peat from the bank and putting it on the grass at the top of the bank.You build the peat into a wall making sure you leave spaces for the wind to blow through. When the peat has dried a little you raise it into small piles.When completely dry you put them in bags.Then the tractor or van can come and collect them and take them home.It is not easy work but if you are prepared to work you have your fuel for the winter.
